Advisory: Intel® NUC Software Studio Service Advisory
Description: Improper initialization in the Intel® NUC Software Studio Service software for Windows may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® NUC Software Studio Service software, all versions. Intel® NUC M15 Laptop Kits: LAPBC510, LAPBC710. Intel® NUC P14E Laptop Element: CMCN1CC.
Recommendation: Intel has issued a product discontinuation notice for Intel® NUC Software Studio Service software.  As of March 30, 2024, the Intel® NUC Software Studio Service software is not supported with any additional functional, security, or other updates. Intel recommends that users of the Intel® NUC Software Studio Service software uninstall it or discontinue use as soon as possible.  Product support for many NUC products has moved to ASUS. Technical and Warranty Support for Intel’s NUC 7 through NUC 13 Systems has transitioned to ASUS as of January 16, 2024. See the NUC Customer Support notice for more information.

Description: Time-of-check time-of-use race condition in some Intel® Neural Compressor software before version v3.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via adjacent access.
Affected Products: Intel® Neural Compressor software before version v3.0.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Neural Compressor software to version v3.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://github.com/intel/neural-compressor/releases

Description: Uncontrolled search path in the Intel® Graphics Driver installers for versions 15.40 and 15.45 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products:
Intel® Graphics Driver for Windows 7 & 8.1 [15.40 6th Gen], all versions: 6th Generation Intel® Core™ processors with Intel® HD Graphics 520/530.
6th Generation Intel® Core™ processors with Intel® Iris™ Graphics 540/550.
Intel® Xeon® processor E3-1500M v5 family with Intel® HD Graphics P530.
Intel® Core™ M with Intel® HD Graphics 515.
Pentium Processors with Intel® HD Graphics 510. Intel® Graphics Driver for Windows 10 [15.40 4th Gen], all versions: 6th Generation Intel® Core™ processors, Intel Core™ M, and related Pentium® processors with Intel® HD Graphics 510, 515, 520, 530.
5th Generation Intel® Core™ processors with Intel HD Graphics 5500, 5600, 6000, Intel Iris™ Graphics 6100, Iris Pro Graphics 6200 and select Pentium®/ Celeron® processors with Intel® HD Graphics.
Intel® Core™ M with Intel HD Graphics 5300.
4th Generation Intel® Core™ Processors with Intel HD Graphics 4200, 4400, 4600, 5000, Intel Iris™ Graphics 5100 and Intel Iris Pro Graphics 5200 and select Pentium®/ Celeron® Processors with Intel® HD Graphics. Intel® Graphics Driver for Windows [15.45], all versions: 6th Generation Intel® Core™ processors with Intel® Iris™ Pro Graphics, Intel® Iris™ Graphics 540/550, Intel® HD Graphics 520/530. 
Intel® Core™ M processors with Intel® HD Graphics 515.
Intel® Xeon® processor E3-1500M v5 family with Intel® HD Graphics P530, Intel® Iris Pro Graphics P580. 
Pentium® and Celeron® Processors with Intel® HD Graphics 500/505.
Pentium Processors with Intel® HD Graphics 510.
Recommendation: Intel has issued a product discontinuation notice for Intel® Graphics Drivers for versions 15.40 and 15.45.  As of June 15, 2024, the Intel® Graphics Drivers for versions 15.40 and 15.45 are not supported with any additional functional, security, or other updates. Intel recommends that users of the Intel® Graphics Drivers for versions 15.40 and 15.45 uninstall it or discontinue use as soon as possible.  Product discontinuation notices https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/18563/intel-graphics-driver-for-windows-7-8-1-15-40-6th-gen.html Intel® Graphics Driver for Windows® 7 & 8.1* [15.40 6th Gen] This download installs the Intel® Graphics Driver for 6th Gen.  https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/18799/intel-graphics-driver-for-windows-15-45.html Intel® Graphics Driver for Windows* [15.45] This download installs the Intel® Graphics Driver for 6th Gen on Windows 7* and Windows 8.1*/10* 64-bit.  https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/18388/intel-graphics-driver-for-windows-10-15-40-4th-gen.html Intel® Graphics Driver for Windows® 10 [15.40][4th Gen] This download installs version 15.40.7.64.4279 of the Intel® Graphics Driver for Windows® 10, 64-bit.

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19504/intel-aptio-v-uefi-firmware-integrator-tools-for-intel-nuc.html

Description: Uncontrolled search path in some Intel® GPA software before version 2024.1 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

Description: Improper conditions check in the Linux kernel mode driver for the Intel® 800 Series Ethernet Driver before version 28.3 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® 800 Series Ethernet Linux Kernel Mode Driver issues: CVE-2024-23981, CVE-2024-21810, CVE-2024-21807, CVE-2024-23497, CVE-2024-24986, CVE-2024-23499  Intel(R) Ethernet Controllers E800 Series with NVM image versions before 3.36 and Intel(R) Ethernet Complete Driver Pack before version 28.3. CVE-2024-21806  Intel(R) Ethernet Controllers E800 Series with NVM image versions before 4.4 CVE-2024-24983  Windows Installer issue: CVE-2024-21769
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating the software for impacted Intel® 800 Series Ethernet Driver to the versions provided below or later.  For the Intel® 800 Series Ethernet Linux Kernel Mode Driver issues: CVE-2024-23981, CVE-2024-21810, CVE-2024-21807, CVE-2024-23497, CVE-2024-24986, CVE-2024-23499:
Update to the Intel® Ethernet Adapter Complete Driver Pack versions 28.3 or later. CVE-2024-23499:
For the Linux Kernel in-tree driver specific patch, update to the latest commit available at this Git location. For the Intel® Ethernet Controllers E800 Series issue: Update to NVM image versions 4.4 or higher included with the Intel® Ethernet Adapter Complete Driver Pack versions 28.3 or higher.
Update to NVM image version 3.36 or higher included Intel® Ethernet Adapter Complete Driver Pack versions 28.3 or later. For the Windows Installer issue: CVE-2024-21769
Update to the Intel® Ethernet Adapter Complete Driver Pack versions 28.3 or later.

Description: Inadequate encryption strength for some BMRA software before version 22.08 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: BMRA software before version 22.08.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of BMRA software update to 22.08 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://github.com/intel/container-experience-kits/releases

Description: Time-of-check Time-of-use race condition in Intel® Neural Compressor software before version 2.5.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Neural Compressor software to version 2.5.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://github.com/intel/neural-compressor/releases.

Advisory: Intel® DSA and Intel® IAA Advisory
Description: Hardware logic with insecure de-synchronization in Intel® DSA and Intel® IAA for some Intel® 4th or 5th generation Xeon® processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enable escalation of privilege local access.
Affected Products:
4th and 5thGeneration Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processors DSA version 1.0 and IAA version 1.0: Product Collection

Platform

Vertical Segment

CPU ID

Device ID

4th Generation Intel® Xeon® Scalable processors

4th Generation Intel® Xeon® Platinum processors

4th Generation Intel® Xeon® Gold Processors

4th Generation Intel® Xeon® Silver Processor

4th Generation Intel® Xeon® Bronze Processor

4th Gen Intel Xeon Scalable Processors with Intel® vRAN

Intel® Xeon® W workstation processors

Eagle Stream

Server, Workstation

806F7

806F8

DSA-8086:0b25
IAA-8086:0cfe

5th Generation Intel® Xeon® Scalable processors

Eagle Stream

Server

C0F62

DSA-8086:0b25
IAA-8086:0cfe
Recommendation: Intel recommends following the steps below to address these issues: Restrict untrusted usage of Intel® DSA/IAA devices on impacted Intel® 4th Generation and 5th Generation Xeon® scalable processors, from VM guest or 3rd party application. Intel has worked with the OS vendor to provide an updated Kernel to mitigate this issue, by disallowing direct access to Intel® DSA and IAA v1.0 devices by untrusted software. Intel recommends using the upstream or LTS Linux kernel with the updated driver containing mitigations. Please contact your OS vendor for updates. In addition, Intel will be updating DSA and TAA libraries to work with the updated kernel version and recommends updating them so they will work with the updated driver. Please see the guidance doc:Intel® Data Streaming Accelerator and Intel® In-Memory Analytics Accelerator Error Reporting

Advisory: Intel® Server Products UEFI Firmware Advisory
Description: Improper input validation of EpsdSrMgmtConfig in UEFI firmware for some Intel® Server Board S2600BP products may allow a privileged user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Server D50DNP Family Intel® Server M50FCP Family Intel® Server Board S2600BP Family
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® Server D50DNP UEFI firmware update to the latest version available at: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/763516/bios-and-firmware-update-package-for-uefi-for-intel-server-d50dnp-family.html  Intel recommends that users of Intel® Server M50FCP UEFI firmware update to the latest version available at: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/775999/bios-and-system-firmware-update-package-sfup-for-windows-and-linux-for-intel-server-m50fcp-family.html  Intel has issued a Product Discontinuation Notice for Intel® Server Board S2600BP as of 05/14/2024 the Intel® Server Board S2600BP is not supported with any additional functional, security, or other updates. Intel recommends that users discontinue use and migrate to the newer generation product listed in Recommendations as soon as possible.

Description: Incorrect default permissions in some onboard video driver software before version 1.14 for Intel® Server Boards based on Intel® 62X Chipset may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Onboard video driver software before version 1.14 for Intel® Server Boards based on Intel® 62X Chipset: Intel® Compute Modules: HNS2600BPB, HNS2600BPB24, HNS2600BPB24R, HNS2600BPBLC, HNS2600BPBLC24, HNS2600BPBLC24R, HNS2600BPBR, HNS2600BPQ, HNS2600BPQ24, HNS2600BPQ24R, HNS2600BPQR, HNS2600BPS, HNS2600BPS24, HNS2600BPS24R, HNS2600BPSR. Intel® Server Boards: MYP1USVB, S2600BPB, S2600BPBR, S2600BPQ, S2600BPQR, S2600BPS, S2600BPSR, S2600STB, S2600STBR, S2600STQ, S2600STQR, S2600WF0, S2600WF0R, S2600WFQ, S2600WFQR, S2600WFT, S2600WFTF, S2600WFTR. Intel® Server Systems: LNETCNT3Y, LNETSLS3Y, M20MYP1UR, MCB2208WFAF4, MCB2208WFAF5, MCB2208WFAF6, MCB2208WFHY2, MCB2224BPHY1, R1208WFTYS, R1304WF0YS, R1304WFTYS, R2208WF0ZS, R2208WFQZS, R2208WFTZS, R2224WFQZS, R2224WFTZS, R2308WFTZS, R2312WF0NP, R2312WFQZS, R2312WFTZS.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating onboard video driver software to version 1.14 or later for Intel® Server Boards based on Intel® 62X Chipset. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19023/

Advisory: Intel® Graphics Command Center Service Software Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path in Intel® Graphics Command Center Service bundled in some Intel® Graphics Windows DCH driver software before versions 31.0.101.3790/31.0.101.2114 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Graphics Command Center Service bundled in Intel® Graphics Windows DCH driver software before versions 31.0.101.3790/31.0.101.2114.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Graphics Command Center Service bundled in Intel® Graphics Windows DCH driver software to versions 31.0.101.3790/31.0.101.2114 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19344/intel-graphics-windows-dch-drivers.html

Advisory: Intel® Media SDK and Intel® oneVPL Software Advisory
Description: Improper buffer restrictions in Intel® Media SDK software all versions may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Media SDK software all versions. Intel® oneVPL software before version 23.3.5.
Recommendation: Intel has issued a Product Discontinuation notice for Intel® Media SDK software and recommends that users of the Intel® Media SDK software uninstall it or discontinue use at their earliest convenience. For continued support and access to new features, Intel® Media SDK software users are encouraged to read the transition guide on upgrading from Intel® Media SDK to Intel® oneVPL, and to move to Intel® oneVPL software as soon as possible.

Description: Improper access control for some Intel® Thunderbolt driver software before version 89 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Thunderbolt driver software before version 89.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® Intel® Thunderbolt driver software update to the latest version provided by the system manufacturer that addresses this issue.

Description: Uncontrolled search path in some Intel® GPA Framework software before version 2023.3 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® GPA software before version 2023.3. Intel® GPA Framework software before version 2023.3.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® GPA and Intel® GPA Framework software to version 2023.3 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/tools/graphics-performance-analyzers/download.html

Advisory: Intel® Ethernet Adapters and Intel® Ethernet Controller I225 Advisory
Description: Improper input validation in some Intel® Ethernet Adapters and Intel® Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via network access.
Affected Products: Intel® Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware before NVM version 1.87. Intel® Ethernet Adapters before version 29.0.1
Recommendation:
Intel recommends that users of Intel® Ethernet Controller I225 Manageability firmware update to the latest version provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues.  Intel recommends updating the Intel® Ethernet Adapter toversion 29.0.1or later.
Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/15084/intel-ethernet-adapter-complete-driver-pack.html?cache=1663009402

Advisory: 2024.1 IPU OOB - Intel® Xeon® D Processor Advisory
Description: Incorrect calculation in microcode keying mechanism for some Intel® Xeon® D Processors with Intel® SGX may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products:
Product Collection

Vertical Segment

CPU ID

Platform ID

Intel® Xeon® D Processor

Embedded

606C1

10
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of affected Intel® Processors update to the latest version firmware provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues.  Intel has released microcode updates for the affected Intel® Processors that are currently supported on the public github repository. Please see details below on access to the microcode: GitHub*: Public Github: https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files For non Intel® Software Guard Extension (SGX) customers the microcode patch can be OS loadable.  Detailed steps on the microcode loading points can be found at: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/articles/technical/software-security-guidance/secure-coding/loading-microcode-os.html  For the mitigation to be effective for Intel® SGX enabled systems, Intel recommends updating the microcode located in platform flash designated by firmware interface table (FIT) entry point1.  To address this vulnerability, a SGX TCB recovery is planned, refer here for more information on the SGX TCB recovery process.  End users and systems administrators should check with their system manufacturers and system software vendors and apply any available updates as soon as practical.  Attestation responses will change as a result of the TCB Recovery. Refer to the Intel SGX Attestation Technical Details documentation for further details.

Advisory: 2024.1 IPU - Intel® Processor Return Predictions Advisory
Description: Non-transparent sharing of return predictor targets between contexts in some Intel® Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: A list of impacted products can be found here.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends that users of affected Intel® Processors update to the latest version firmware provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues. Intel has released microcode updates for the affected Intel® Processors that are currently supported on the public github repository. Please see details below on access to the microcode: 
GitHub*: Public Github: https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files For non Intel® Software Guard Extension (SGX) customers the microcode patch can be OS loadable. For the mitigation to be effective for Intel® SGX enabled systems, Intel recommends updating the microcode located in platform flash designated by firmware interface table (FIT) entry point1.
Detailed steps on the microcode loading points can be found at:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/articles/technical/software-security-guidance/secure-coding/loading-microcode-os.html End users and systems administrators should check with their system manufacturers and system software vendors and apply any available updates as soon as practical. To address this vulnerability, a SGX TCB recovery is planned, refer here for more information on the SGX TCB recovery process. Attestation responses will change as a result of the TCB Recovery. Refer to the Intel SGX Attestation Technical Details documentation for further details.

Advisory: 2024.1 IPU - Intel® Chipset Software and SPS Advisory
Description: Insertion of sensitive information into log file for some Intel® Local Manageability Service software before version 2316.5.1.2 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® SPS before SPS_E5_04.04.04.500.0 or SPS_E5_06.01.02.048.0. Intel® CSME software installer before version 2328.5.5.0. Intel® Local Manageability Service before version 2316.5.1.2.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® SPS update to the latest version provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues.

Description: Information exposure through microarchitectural state after transient execution from some register files for some Intel® Atom® Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: A list of impacted products can be found here.
Recommendation:
Intel has worked with operating system vendors, equipment manufacturers, and other ecosystem partners to develop platform firmware and software updates that can help protect systems from these methods.  This includes the releasing of updated microcode to our customers and partners to enable software to mitigate this potential vulnerability. On affected processors, the processor will enumerate RFDS_CLEAR when this microcode is loaded.  Intel may enumerate RFDS_NO on the products that are not affected by this issue. Some unaffected parts may only enumerate RFDS_NO when a microcode is update is loaded.  Intel has released microcode updates for the affected Intel® Processors that are currently supported on the public github repository. Please see details below on access to the microcode: 
GitHub*: Public Github: https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files  For non Intel® Software Guard Extension (SGX) customers the microcode patch can be OS loadable.  For the mitigation to be effective for Intel® SGX enabled systems, Intel recommends updating the microcode located in platform flash designated by firmware interface table (FIT) entry point1. Detailed steps on the microcode loading points can be found at:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/articles/technical/software-security-guidance/secure-coding/loading-microcode-os.html  End users and systems administrators should check with their system manufacturers and system software vendors and apply any available updates as soon as practical.  To address this vulnerability, a SGX TCB recovery is planned, refer here for more information on the SGX TCB recovery process. Attestation responses will change as a result of the TCB Recovery. Refer to the Intel SGX Attestation Technical Details documentation for further details.  Related Content: Technical Paper: Register file data sampling

Description: Improper input validation in some Intel® SGX DCAP software for Windows before version 1.19.100.3 may allow an authenticateed user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® SGX DCAP software for Windows before version 1.19.100.3.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® SGX DCAP software for Windows to version 1.19.100.3  or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/683952/intel-software-guard-extensions-intel-sgx-driver-and-data-center-attestation-primitives-intel-sgx-dcap.html

Description: Uncontrolled search path element in some Intel® SSU software before version 3.0.0.2 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® SSU software before 3.0.0.2.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® SSU software for Windows update to 3.0.0.2 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/18377/intel-system-support-utility-for-windows.html

Description: Improper access control for some Intel® Unison™ software before version C15 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Unison™ software before version C15.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® Unison™ software to version C15 or later. Intel recommends updating Intel® Unison™ mobile applications and Windows software to mitigate these potential vulnerabilities.  Updated software for Windows 11 is available for download at this location:
https://apps.microsoft.com/store/detail/intel%C2%AE-unison%E2%84%A2/9PP9GZM2GN26 Updated app for android is available for download at this location:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.intel.mde&hl=en_US&gl=US&pli=1  Updated app for Apple iOS is available for download at this location: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/intel-unison/id1613307037

Description: Uncontrolled search path for some Intel® MPI Library Software before version 2021.11 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® MPI Library software before version 2021.11.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® MPI Library software update to 2021.11. or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/articles/tool/oneapi-standalone-components.html

Advisory: Intel® SUR for Gameplay Software Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path in the Intel® SUR for Gameplay Software before version 2.0.1901 may allow a privillaged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® System Usage Report for Gameplay Software version 2.0.1901.
Recommendation:
Intel has issued a Product Discontinuation notice for Intel® System Usage Report for Gameplay Software and recommends that users of the Intel® System Usage Report for Gameplay Software uninstall it or discontinue use at their earliest convenience and upgrade to the latest version of Intel® System Usage Report, version 2.4.10587 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19296

Description: Uncontrolled resource consumption for some Intel® SPS firmware before version SPS_E5_06.01.04.002.0 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable denial of service via network access.
Affected Products: Intel® SPS before SPS_E5_06.01.04.002.0.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® SPS update to the latest version provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues.

Description: Out-of-bounds read in some Intel® QAT software drivers for Windows before version QAT1.7-W-1.11.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® QAT software drivers for Windows before version QAT1.7-W-1.11.0.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® QAT software drivers for Windows to version QAT1.7-W-1.11.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19732

Description: Improper access control in some Intel® SUR software before version 2.4.10587 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via adjacent access.
Affected Products: Intel® SUR software before version 2.4.10587.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® SUR software to version 2.4.10587 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19296

Description: Uncontrolled search path in some Intel® ISPC software before version 1.21.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® ISPC before version 1.21.0.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® ISPC to version v1.21.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://github.com/ispc/ispc/releases

Advisory: Intel® Ethernet Tools and Driver Install Software Advisory
Description: Insecure inherited permissions in some Intel® Ethernet tools and driver install software may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Installation software for Intel® Ethernet Connections Boot Utility, Preboot Images, and EFI Drivers before version 28.2. Installation software for Administrative Tools for Intel® Network Adapters before version 28.2. Installation software for Intel® Ethernet Adapter Complete Driver Pack before version 28.2. CVE-2023-33870 Intel® Ethernet Connections Boot Utility, Preboot Images, and EFI Drivers Administrative Tools for Intel® Network Adapters CVE-2023-39432 Intel® Ethernet Adapter Complete Driver Pack
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating to the versions below: Intel® Ethernet Connections Boot Utility, Preboot Images, and EFI Drivers to version 28.2 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: 
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/15755/intel-ethernet-connections-boot-utility-preboot-images-and-efi-drivers.html?wapkw=preboot%20  Administrative Tools for Intel® Network Adapters to version 28.2 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: 
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/2593/administrative-tools-for-intel-network-adapters.html?wapkw=administrative%20tools%20  Intel® Ethernet Adapter Complete Driver Pack to version 28.2.0.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: 
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/15084/intel-ethernet-adapter-complete-driver-pack.html?wapkw=complete%20driver%20pack

Advisory: Intel® SDK for OpenCL™ Applications Software Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path in some Intel® SDK for OpenCL™ Applications software may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® SDK for OpenCL™ Applications software all versions.
Recommendation: Intel has issued a Product Discontinuation notice for Intel® SDK for OpenCL™ Applications software and recommends that users of the Intel® SDK for OpenCL™ Applications software uninstall it or discontinue use at their earliest convenience.

Description: Improper buffer restrictions the Intel(R) C++ Compiler Classic before version 2021.8 for Intel(R) oneAPI Toolkits before version 2022.3.1 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

Intel® oneAPI HPC Toolkit before version 2023.2.0. Intel® oneAPI IoT Toolkit before version 2023.2.0. Intel® oneAPI Math Kernel Library before version 2023.2.0. Intel® oneAPI Threading Building Blocks before version 2021.10.0. Intel® Trace Analyzer and Collector 2021.10.0. Intel® VTune™ Profiler for oneAPI before version 2023.2.0.

Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/tools/oneapi/toolkits.html  Intel recommends updating Intel® oneAPI standalone component software to the latest versions. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/articles/tool/oneapi-standalone-components.html

Advisory: Intel®  Battery Life Diagnostic Tool Software Advisory

Affected Products: Intel Unite® Client software before version 4.2.35041.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel Unite® Client software to the final version 4.2.35041 to address these issues.  This final update is available for download at this location:

Advisory: Intel® QSFP+ Configuration Utility Software Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path in Intel® QSFP+ Configuration Utility software, all versions, may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® QSFP+ Configuration Utility software all versions.
Recommendation:
Intel has issued a Product Discontinuation notice for Intel® QSFP+ Configuration Utility software and recommends that users of the Intel® QSFP+ Configuration Utility software uninstall it or discontinue use at their earliest convenience.  Intel® QSFP+ Configuration Utility software has been replaced by the Ethernet Port Configuration Tool (EPCT). EPCT software is available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19435

Advisory: Intel® Binary Configuration Tool Software Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path in some Intel® Binary Configuration Tool software before version 3.4.4 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Binary Configuration Tool software before version 3.4.4.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Binary Configuration Tool software to version 3.4.4 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://github.com/intel/BCT

Description: Improper access control in some Intel® DSA software before version 23.4.33 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® DSA software before version 23.4.33.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends that users of Intel® DSA software update to 23.4.33 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/intel-driver-support-assistant.html

Description: Race condition in some Intel® MAS software before version 2.3 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® MAS software before version 2.3.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Memory and Storage Tool software to version 2.3 or later. Updates are available for download at these locations: Linux https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/secure/design/confidential/software-kits/kit-details.html?kitId=730768  Windows https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/secure/design/confidential/software-kits/kit-details.html?kitId=730764

Description: Uncontrolled search path in some Intel® CIP software before version 2.4.10577 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® CIP software before version 2.4.10577.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® CIP software to version 2.4.10577 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19296

Description: Improper authorization in some Intel® PM software may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® PM software all versions.
Recommendation:
Intel has issued a Product Discontinuation notice for Intel® PM and recommends that users of the Intel® PM uninstall it or discontinue use at their earliest convenience.  Intel also recommends replacing Intel® PM software with Intel® Extreme Tuning Utility (XTU) software.  Intel® XTU software is available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/17881

Description: Improper access control in some Intel® oneAPI Toolkit and component software installers before version 4.3.2 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products:
Intel® oneAPI Toolkit and component software installer before version 4.3.2 found in the following products: Intel® Advisor for oneAPI before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® CPU Runtime for OpenCL™ Applications before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Distribution for Python* programming language before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® DPC++ Compatibility Tool before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Embree Ray Tracing Kernel Library before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Fortran Compiler before version 2023.2.1.
Intel® Implicit SPMD Program Compiler before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Inspector for oneAPI before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Integrated Performance Primitives before version 2021.9.0.
Intel® IPP Cryptography before version 2021.8.0.
Intel® MPI Library before version 2021.10.0.
Intel® oneAPI Base Toolkit before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI Data Analytics Library before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI Deep Neural Network Library before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI DPC++/C++ Compiler before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI DPC++ Library (oneDPL) before version 2022.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI HPC Toolkit before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI IoT Toolkit before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI Math Kernel Library before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI Rendering Toolkit before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® oneAPI Threading Building Blocks before version 2021.10.0.
Intel® oneAPI Video Processing Library before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Open Image Denoise before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Open Volume Kernel Library before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® OSPRay before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® OSPRay Studio before version 2023.2.0.
Intel® Trace Analyzer and Collector before version 2021.10.0.
Intel® VTune™ Profiler for oneAPI before version 2023.2.0.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® oneAPI Toolkits to version 2023.2.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/tools/oneapi/toolkits.html  Intel recommends updating Intel® oneAPI standalone component software to the latest versions. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/articles/tool/oneapi-standalone-components.html

Description: Improper access control in some Intel® XTU software before version 7.12.0.29 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® XTU software before version 7.12.0.29.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® XTU software to version 7.12.0.29 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/17881

Description: Buffer underflow in some Intel® PCM software before version 202307 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via network access.
Affected Products: Intel® PCM software before version 202307.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® PCM software to version 202307 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://github.com/intel/pcm/releases

Description: Path transversal in some Intel® VROC software before version 8.0.8.1001 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® VROC software before version 8.0.8.1001.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® VROC update to the latest version provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues.

Advisory: Intel® Optane™ PMem Management Software Advisory
Description: Improper access control in some Intel® Optane™ PMem software before versions 01.00.00.3547, 02.00.00.3915, 03.00.00.0483 may allow an athenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Optane™ PMem 100 Series management software before version 01.00.00.3547. Intel® Optane™ PMem 200 Series management software before version 02.00.00.3915. Intel® Optane™ PMem 300 Series management software before version 03.00.00.0483.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Optane™ PMem to the latest version. Updates are available for download at this location: https://github.com/intel/ipmctl/releases

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/secure/design/confidential/software-kits/kit-details.html?kitId=781804 Intel recommends updating Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi software to version 3.1423.712 or later. Updates for Intel® Killer™ products are available for download at this location:

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/secure/design/confidential/software-kits/kit-details.html?kitId=782847 Chrome OS: Intel® PROSet/Wireless Wi-Fi drivers to mitigate this vulnerability will be up streamed to Chromium by September 19, 2023. Advisory: Arm DS for Intel® SoC FPGA Software Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path element in some Arm DS for Intel® SoC FPGA installation software may allow an authentication user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Arm DS for Intel® SoC FPGA software, all versions.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Arm DS for Intel® SoC FPGA software using Arm documentation on installer vulnerabilities as detailed by Arm at this location: https://developer.arm.com/documentation/ka005596/latest

Description: Improper access control in some Intel® Chipset Driver Software before version 10.1.19444.8378 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Chipset Driver Software before version 10.1.19444.8378.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Chipset Driver Software to version 10.1.19444.8378 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/776553

Description: Protection mechanism failure in some Intel® OFU software before version 14.1.31 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® OFU software before version 14.1.31.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® OFU software to version 14.1.31 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19032

Description: Improper authentication in some Intel(R) Server Product OpenBMC firmware before version egs-1.09 may allow an authenticated user to enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Sapphire Rapids Eagle Stream with 4th Generation Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processors before version PLR4 Release.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of OpenBMC update to the latest version provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues.

Description: Incorrect default permissions in some ACAT software maintained by Intel® before version 2.0.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: ACAT software maintained by Intel® before version 2.0.0.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating ACAT software maintained by Intel® to version 2.0.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://github.com/intel/acat/releases

Description: Improper buffer restrictions in Intel® Optimization for TensorFlow before version 2.13.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Optimization for TensorFlow before version 2.13.0.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® Optimization for TensorFlow to version 2.13.0 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/releases

Description: Improper access control in firmware for some Intel(R) Thunderbol(TM) Controllers versions before 41 may allow a privileged user to enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® JHL8440 Thunderbolt™ 4 Controller firmware versions before 41.
Recommendation: Intel recommends that users of Intel® Thunderbolt™ Controllers update to the latest version provided by the system manufacturer that addresses these issues.

Advisory: Intel® ThunderboltTM DCH Drivers for Windows Advisory
Description: Unchecked return value in some Intel(R) Thunderbolt(TM) DCH drivers for Windows before version 88 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via physical access.
Affected Products: Intel® Thunderbolt™ DCH driver for Windows before version 88. CVE-2023-22293: All 6th, 7th, 8th, or 9th Generation Intel® Core processor with Intel® Thunderbolt™ DCH driver all versions.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Thunderbolt™ DCH driver to version 88 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/secure/design/confidential/software-kits/kit-details.html?kitId=746994&wapkw=746994  For CVE-2023-22293: Intel recommends setting the Intel® Thunderbolt™ Security Level to SL3 or SL4 in the system BIOS menu and ensure that BIOS access is password protected.

Advisory: Intel® Core™ Processors with Radeon™ RX Vega M Graphics  Advisory
Description: Insufficient bounds checking in the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) may allow an attacker to access memory outside the bounds of what is permissible to a TA (Trusted Application) resulting in a potential denial of service.
Affected Products:
Intel® Core™ processors with Radeon™ RX Vega M before version 23.10.01.46: Intel® NUC Kit NUC8i7HNK, NUC8i7HVK
Intel® NUC 8 Enthusiast, a Mini PC with Windows 10 - NUC8i7HVKVA
Intel® NUC 8 Business, a Mini PC with Windows 10 - NUC8i7HNKQC
Intel® NUC 8 Enthusiast, a Mini PC with Windows 10 - NUC8i7HVKVAW
Intel® Core™ i7-8709G Processor with Radeon™ RX Vega M GH graphics
Intel® Core™ i7-8706G Processor with Radeon™ RX Vega M GL graphics
Intel® Core™ i7-8705G Processor with Radeon™ RX Vega M GL graphics
Intel® Core™ i5-8305G Processor with Radeon™ Pro WX Vega M GL graphics
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Radeon™ RX Vega M Graphics Driver for Windows® 10 64-bit for NUC8i7HNK, NUC8i7HVK to version 23.10.01.46.
Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19269/radeon-rx-vega-m-graphics-driver-for-windows-10-64-bit-for-nuc8i7hnk-nuc8i7hvk.html Intel recommends updating Radeon™ RX Vega M Graphics for Dell* XPS Laptops to version 31.0.21001.46001.
Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/786439/radeon-rx-vega-m-graphics-for-dell-xps-laptops.html

Intel recommends updating Radeon™ RX Vega M Graphics for HP* Spectre Laptops to version 31.0.21001.46001.
Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/786424/radeon-rx-vega-m-graphics-for-hp-spectre-laptops.html

Description: Improper access control in some Intel® In-Band Manageability software before version 3.0.14 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® In-Band Manageability software before version 3.0.14.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating to Intel® In-Band Manageability software version 3.0.14 or later. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://github.com/intel/intel-inb-manageability/tree/v3.0.14

Description: Incomplete cleanup for some Intel® Unison™ software may allow a privileged user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Unison™ software for Windows before version 20.14.5683.0. Intel® Unison™ software for Android before version 20.14.4244. Intel® Unison™ software for  Apple iOS applications before version 20.14.2.3053.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® Unison™ mobile applications and Windows software to mitigate these potential vulnerabilities. Updated software for Windows 11 is available for download at this location:
https://apps.microsoft.com/store/detail/intel%C2%AE-unison%E2%84%A2/9PP9GZM2GN26 Updated app for android is available for download at this location:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.intel.mde&hl=en_US&gl=US&pli=1 Updated app for Apple iOS is available for download at this location:
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/intel-unison/id1613307037

Advisory: Intel® Rapid Storage Technology Software Advisory
Description: Insecure inherited permissions in some Intel® Rapid Storage Technology software before version 16.8.5.1014.9 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Rapid Storage Technology software before version 16.8.5.1014.9.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® Rapid Storage Technology software to version 16.8.5.1014.9 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19755/intel-rapid-storage-technology-driver-installation-software-with-intel-optane-memory-8th-and-9th-gen-platforms.html

Description: Out-of-bounds write in firmware for some Intel(R) FPGA products before version 2.8.1 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products:
Intel® Agilex™ 7 FPGA and SoC FPGA product families.

Intel® Stratix® 10 FPGA and SoC FPGA product families.

Advisory: Intel® Server Board BMC Video Driver Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path element for some Intel(R) Server Board M10JNP2SB integrated BMC video drivers before version 3.0 for Microsoft Windows and before version 1.13.4 for linux may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Server Board M10JNP2SB Integrated BMC Video Drivers before version 3.0 for Microsoft Windows and before version 1.13.4 for Linux.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Integrated BMC Video Driver for Server Systems Based on the Intel® Server Board M10JNP2SB to version 3.0 or later for Microsoft Windows. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19467/integrated-bmc-video-driver-for-server-systems-based-on-the-intel-server-board-m10jnp2sb.html  Intel recommends updating Integrated BMC Video Driver for Server Systems Based on the Intel® Server Board M10JNP2SB to version 1.13.4 or later for Linux. Updates are available for download at this location:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19578/integrated-bmc-video-driver-linux-for-server-systems-based-on-the-intel-server-board-m10jnp2sb.html

Description: Use of hard-coded credentials in some Intel(R) Unison(TM) software before version 10.12 may allow an authenticated user user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

Intel recommends updating Intel® Unison™ software to version 10.12 or later. Updates for Windows 11 are available for download at this location:
https://apps.microsoft.com/store/detail/intel%C2%AE-unison%E2%84%A2/9PP9GZM2GN26 Updates for the Android version are available for download at this location: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.intel.mde&hl=en_US&gl=US&pli=1 Updates for the Apple iOS version are available for download at this location:
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/intel-unison/id1613307037

Affected Products:

Intel® CPU Runtime for OpenCL™ Applications before version 2023.1.
Intel® Distribution for Python* programming language before version 2023.1.
Intel® DPC++ Compatibility Tool before version 2023.1.
Intel® Embree Ray Tracing Kernel Library before version 2023.1.
Intel® Fortran Compiler before version 2023.1.
Intel® Implicit SPMD Program Compiler before version 1.19.1.
Intel® Inspector for oneAPI before version 2023.1.
Intel® Integrated Performance Primitives before version 2021.8.
Intel® IPP Cryptography before version 2021.7.0.
Intel® MPI Library before version 2021.9.
Intel® oneAPI Base Toolkit before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI Data Analytics Library before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI Deep Neural Network Library before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI DPC++/C++ Compiler before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI DPC++ Library (oneDPL) before version 2022.1.
Intel® oneAPI HPC Toolkit before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI IoT Toolkit before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI Math Kernel Library before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI Rendering Toolkit before version 2023.1.
Intel® oneAPI Threading Building Blocks before version 2021.9.0.
Intel® oneAPI Video Processing Library before version 2023.1.

Intel® OSPRay before version 2023.1.
Intel® OSPRay Studio before version 2023.1.
Intel® Trace Analyzer and Collector before version 2021.9.0.

Intel® VTune™ Profiler for oneAPI before version 2023.1.

Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/tools/oneapi/toolkits.html  Intel recommends updating Intel® oneAPI standalone component software to the latest versions. Description: Uncontrolled search path for the Intel(R) AI Hackathon software before version 2.0.0 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access.

Description: Improper access control in the Intel® DTT Software before version 8.7.10400.15482 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

Intel recommends that users of Intel® NUC P14E Laptop Element with Intel® DTT Software before version 8.7.10400.15482 update to the latest version available. Updates are available at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19824

Description: Insecure inherited permissions in some Intel(R) oneMKL software before version 2022.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® oneMKL software before version 2022.0.

Description: Uncontrolled search path element in some Intel(R) Quartus(R) Prime Pro and Standard edition software for linux may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products:
Intel® Quartus® Prime Pro edition software for Linux before version 22.4.

Intel® Quartus® Prime Standard edition software for Linux before version 22.1STD.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating the Intel® Quartus® Prime Pro edition software for Linux to version 22.4 or later. Intel recommends updating the Intel® Quartus® Prime Standard edition software for Linux to version 22.1STD or later. Updates are available for download at these locations: http://fpgasoftware.intel.com/?edition=pro http://fpgasoftware.intel.com/?edition=standard

Description: Uncontrolled search path in some Intel(R) RST software before versions 16.8.5.1014.5, 17.11.3.1010.2, 18.7.6.1011.2 and 19.5.2.1049.5 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Recommendation:
Intel recommends updating Intel® RST software to the latest versions. Updates are available for download at the following locations: Intel® RST Driver Installation Software with Intel® Optane™ Memory (11th up to 13th Gen Platforms) to version 19.5.2.1049.5 or later:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/720755/
Intel® RST Driver Installation Software with Intel® Optane™ Memory (10th and 11th Gen Platforms) to version 18.7.6.1010.3 or later:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19512
Intel® RST Driver Installation Software with Intel® Optane™ Memory (8th and 9th Gen Platforms) to version 17.11.3.1010.2 or later:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19755
Intel® RST User Interface and Driver software to version 16.8.5.1014.5 or later:
https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/15667

Advisory: Intel® Ethernet Controller RDMA Driver for Linux Advisory
Description: Improper access control in the Intel(R) Ethernet Controller RDMA driver for linux before version 1.9.30 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access.
Affected Products: Intel® Ethernet Controller RDMA driver for linux before version 1.9.30.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating the Intel® Ethernet Controller RDMA driver for linux to version 1.9.30 or later. Intel® Ethernet Controller RDMA driver for linux to mitigate this vulnerability will be up streamed by August 08, 2023. Consult the regular open-source channels to obtain this update.

Description: Improper input validation in firmware for some Intel(R) PCSD BIOS before version 02.01.0013 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

Intel® PCSD BIOS before version 02.01.0013 in the following products: Intel® Server Board:
S2600WFT, S2600WFTF, S2600WFTR, S2600WFQ, S2600WFQR, S2600WF0, S2600WF0R.


Intel® Server System:
R1208WFQYSR, R1208WFTYS, R1208WFTYSR.
R1304WF0YS, R1304WF0YSR, R1304WFTYS, R1304WFTYSR.
R2208WF0ZS, R2208WF0ZSR, R2208WFQZS, R2208WFQZSR, R2208WFTZS, R2208WFTZSR.
R2224WFQZS, R2224WFTZS, R2224WFTZSR.
R2308WFTZS, R2308WFTZSR.
R2312WF0NP, R2312WF0NPR, R2312WFQZS, R2312WFTZS, R2312WFTZSR.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® PCSD BIOS to version 02.01.0013 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/download/19078/

Description: Uncontrolled resource consumption in some Intel(R) SSD Tools software before version mdadm-4.2-rc2 may allow a priviledged user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.

Description: Improper buffer restrictions in the Intel(R) C++ Compiler Classic before version 2021.7.1 for some Intel(R) oneAPI Toolkits before version 2022.3.1 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

Advisory: Intel® AMT and Intel® Standard Manageability Advisory
Description: Improper access control in firmware for Intel(R) AMT and Intel(R) Standard Manageability may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via physical access.
Affected Products: All versions of Intel® AMT and Intel® Standard Manageability. Note: Firmware versions of Intel® AMT 3.x through 10.x are no longer supported versions. There is no new general release planned for these versions. Intel will only provide prescriptive guidance for supported versions; no code changes are planned.

Description: Sensitive information in resource not removed before reuse in firmware for some Intel(R) SSD and Intel(R) Optane(TM) SSD Products may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via physical access.

Updates for Killer™ drivers with Windows 10 are available for download at this location: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/secure/design/confidential/products-and-solutions/wireless-and-modems/wireless-software/killer-performance-suite.html  Linux OS: Intel® Wireless Bluetooth® firmware to mitigate these vulnerabilities will be up streamed to Linux before May 23rd, 2021. Description: Bluetooth LE and BR/EDR secure pairing in Bluetooth Core Specification 2.1 through 5.2 may permit a nearby man-in-the-middle attacker to identify the Passkey used during pairing (in the Passkey authentication procedure) by reflection of the public key and the authentication evidence of the initiating device, potentially permitting this attacker to complete authenticated pairing with the responding device using the correct Passkey for the pairing session. The attack methodology determines the Passkey value one bit at a time.
Affected Products: All Linux kernel versions prior to 5.13 that support BlueZ.

Advisory: Intel® PROSet/Wireless WiFi , Intel vPro® CSME WiFi and Killer™ WiFi Advisory Advisory
Description: Frame aggregation attack: Devices allow the encrypted payload to be parsed as containing one or more aggregated frames instead of a normal network packet.
Affected Products: Intel® PROSet/Wireless WiFi products: Intel® Wi-Fi 6E AX210 Intel® Wi-Fi 6 AX201 Intel® Wi-Fi 6 AX200 Intel® Wireless-AC 9560 Intel® Wireless-AC 9462 Intel® Wireless-AC 9461 Intel® Wireless-AC 9260 Intel® Dual Band Wireless-AC 8265 Intel® Dual Band Wireless-AC 8260 Intel® Dual Band Wireless-AC 3168 Intel® Wireless 7265 (Rev D) Family Intel® Dual Band Wireless-AC 3165  Intel vPRO® CSME WiFi products: Intel® Wi-Fi 6 AX201 Intel® Wi-Fi 6 AX200 Intel® Wireless-AC 9560 Intel® Wireless-AC 9260 Intel® Dual Band Wireless-AC 8265 Intel® Dual Band Wireless-AC 8260  Killer™ WiFi products: Killer™ Wi-Fi 6E AX1675 Killer™ Wi-Fi 6 AX1650 Killer™ Wireless-AC 1550

Advisory: Intel® Trace Analyzer and Collector Advisory
Description: Uncontrolled search path in the Intel(R) Trace Analyzer and Collector before version 2020 update 3 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Trace Analyzer and Collector before version 2020 update 3.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating the Intel® Trace Analyzer and Collector to version 2020 update 3 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://software.intel.com/content/www/us/en/develop/tools/oneapi/components/trace-analyzer.html

Description: Insecure inherited permissions for the Intel(R) SOC driver package for STK1A32SC before version 604 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® SOC Driver Package for STK1A32SC before version 604.

Description: Incorrect default permissions in installer for the Intel(R) SSD Toolbox versions before 2/9/2021 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

Description: Buffer overflow in the firmware for Intel(R) E810 Ethernet Controllers before version 1.4.1.13 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable a denial of service via local access.

Intel® Core™ Processor i3-1000G1, i3-1000G4, i3-1005G1

Description: Expired pointer dereference in some Intel(R) Graphics Drivers before version 26.20.100.8141 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable a denial of service via local access.

Advisory: Intel® Processors Load Value Injection Advisory
Description: Load value injection in some Intel(R) Processors utilizing speculative execution may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via a side channel with local access.
Affected Products: A list of impacted products can be found here.

Description: Improper data forwarding in some data cache for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: A list of impacted products can be found here.

Advisory: Intel® Optane™ DC Persistent Memory Module Management Software Advisory
Description: Unquoted service path in Intel(R) Optane(TM) DC Persistent Memory Module Management Software before version 1.0.0.3461 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege and denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Optane™ DC Persistent Memory Module Management Software before version 1.0.0.3461.

Advisory: Intel® FPGA Programmable Acceleration Card N3000 Advisory
Description: Improper access control in on-card storage for the Intel® FPGA Programmable Acceleration Card N3000, all versions, may allow a privileged user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: The Intel® FPGA Programmable Acceleration Card N3000 all versions.

Description: Improper initialization in Intel(R) Graphics Drivers before versions 15.40.44.5107, 15.45.29.5077, and 26.20.100.7000 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable a denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Graphics Drivers for 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th, 7th, 8th, 9th, 10th Generation Intel® Processors for Windows* 7, 8.1, and 10 before versions 15.40.44.5107, 15.45.29.5103, 26.20.100.7584, 15.33.49.5100 and 15.36.38.5117.

Description: Improper permissions in the installer for Intel(R) RWC3 for Windows* before version 7.010.009.000 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® RWC3 before version 7.010.009.000.

Description: Improper permissions in the installer for Intel(R) MPSS before version 3.8.6 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® MPSS before version 3.8.6.

Description: Improper permissions in the installer for Intel(R) RWC2, all versions, may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® RWC2, all versions.

Description: Improper initialization in the Intel(R) SGX SDK may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® SGX SDK before v2.6.100.1 for Windows*, and Intel® SGX SDK before v2.8.100.1 for Linux

Description: Improper Authentication in subsystem in Intel(R) CSME versions 12.0 through 12.0.48 (IOT only: 12.0.56), versions 13.0 through 13.0.20, versions 14.0 through 14.0.10 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege, denial of service or information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® CSME versions before 12.0.49 (IOT only: 12.0.56), 13.0.21, 14.0.11.

Advisory: Intel® Renesas Electronics® USB 3.0 Driver Advisory
Description: Improper permissions in the installer for the Intel(R) Renesas Electronics(R) USB 3.0 Driver, all versions, may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Renesas Electronics® USB 3.0 Driver, all versions.

Description: Cleanup errors in some data cache evictions for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: A list of impacted products can be found here.

Description: Improper permissions in Intel(R) DAAL before version 2020 Gold may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure.
Affected Products: Intel® DAAL before version 2020 Gold.

Advisory: Intel® VTune™ Amplifier for Windows* Advisory
Description: Improper access control in driver for Intel(R) VTune(TM) Amplifier for Windows*  before update 8 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® VTune™ Amplifier for Windows* before update 8.
Recommendation: Intel recommends updating Intel® VTune™ Amplifier for Windows* to update 8 or later. Updates are available for download at this location: https://software.intel.com/en-us/vtune/choose-download

Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processors
2nd Generation Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processors
Intel® Xeon® Processor D Family

Intel® Xeon® Processor E7 v4 Family

Advisory: 2019.2 IPU – Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processors Voltage Setting Modulation Advisory
Description: Improper conditions check in the voltage modulation interface for some Intel(R) Xeon(R) Scalable Processors may allow a privileged user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
TSX Asynchronous Abort condition on some CPUs utilizing speculative execution may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via a side channel with local access.
Affected Products: This issue affects all current processors that support Intel© TSX unless IA32_ARCH_CAPABILITIES.TAA_NO (bit 8)=1. On CPUs affected by MDS, where IA32_ARCH_CAPABILITIES.MDS_NO (bit 5)=0, the existing MDS mitigations will also mitigate against TAA. A list of impacted products can be found here.

Advisory: 2019.2 IPU – Intel® Processor Graphics Update Advisory
Description: Insufficient access control in subsystem for Intel (R) processor graphics in 6th, 7th, 8th and 9th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) Processor Families; Intel(R) Pentium(R) Processor J, N, Silver and Gold Series; Intel(R) Celeron(R) Processor J, N, G3900 and G4900 Series; Intel(R) Atom(R) Processor A and E3900 Series; Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processor E3-1500 v5 and v6 and E-2100 Processor Families may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: 6th, 7th, 8th and 9th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) Processor Families; Intel(R) Pentium(R) Processor J, N, Silver and Gold Series; Intel(R) Celeron(R) Processor J, N, G3900 and G4900 Series; Intel(R) Atom(R) Processor A and E3900 Series; Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processor E3-1500 v5 and v6 and E-2100 Processor Families.

Description: Insufficient access control in firmware Intel(R) Ethernet 700 Series
Affected Products: Intel® Ethernet 700 Series Controller firmware before 7.0. Intel® Ethernet 700 Series Controller Software before release version 24.0.

Advisory: Intel Unite® Client for Android* Advisory
Description: A logic issue in Intel Unite(R) Client for Android prior to version 4.0 may allow a remote attacker to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access.
Affected Products: Intel Unite® Client for Android before version 4.0.

Description: Improper directory permissions in the installer for Intel(R) Quartus(R) software may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Quartus® Prime all versions 15.1 to 18.1. Intel® Quartus® II versions 9.1 to 15.0.

Advisory: Intel® SCS Discovery Utility and Intel® ACU Wizard Advisory
Description: Unquoted service path in the installer for the Intel(R) SCS Discovery Utility version 12.0.0.129 and earlier may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® SCS Discovery Utility: SCS_download_package before version 12.0.0.129. Intel® ACU Wizard: Configurator_download_package before version 12.0.0.129.
A list of impacted products can be found here.
Recommendation: Intel has worked with operating system vendors, equipment manufacturers, and other ecosystem partners to develop platform firmware and software updates that can help protect systems from these methods. This includes the release of updated Intel microprocessor microcode to our customers and partners. Intel has released microcode updates for the affected Intel® Processors that are currently supported on the public github repository. Please see details below on access to the microcode: Public Github: https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files GitHub® link for 10th Generation Intel® Core™ Processor Family (Ice Lake) : https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files/releases/tag/microcode-20200508 End users and systems administrators should check with their system manufacturers and system software vendors and apply any available updates as soon as practical. In addition, for Intel® SGX, Intel performed a TCB Recovery operation to enable parties utilizing SGX to determine whether the microcode version related to this Intel Security Advisory has been applied on the platform the SGX attestation request originated from. Intel has updated the Intel SGX Attestation Service (IAS) Dev environment on June 14th, 2019 and the IAS Production environment on July 12th, 2019, to return “GROUP_OUT_OF_DATE” response for affected platforms without the BIOS applied microcode update, and “CONFIGURATION_NEEDED” response for affected platforms that applied the microcode update through BIOS but with Intel® Hyper-Threading technology enabled. Additional Advisory Guidance on CVE-2018-12126, CVE-2018-12127, CVE-2018-12130, CVE-2019-11091 available here.

Advisory: Intel® QuickAssist Technology for Linux Advisory
Description: Improper memory handling in Intel(R) QuickAssist Technology for Linux (all versions) may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable a denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel(R) QuickAssist Technology for Linux.

Advisory: Intel® System Defense Utility Vulnerability Advisory
Description: Improper directory permissions in the installer for the Intel(R) System Defense Utility may allow authenticated users to potentially enable a denial of service via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® System Defense Utility all versions

Advisory: Intel® Parallel Studio XE for Windows* Vulnerability Advisory
Description: Improper directory permissions in the installer for the Intel(R) Parallel Studio XE for Windows* may allow authenticated users to potentially enable an escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Parallel Studio XE for Windows* before Intel® Parallel Studio XE 2019 Gold.

Advisory: Intel® Solid State Drive Toolbox File Permissions Advisory
Description: Improper directory permissions in Intel(R) Solid State Drive Toolbox before 3.5.7 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Solid State Drive Toolbox before 3.5.7

Advisory: Intel® VTune Amplifier 2018 for Windows* Update 3 Advisoy
Description: Improper file permissions in the installer for Intel(R) VTune Amplifier 2018 for Windows* Update 3 and before may allow unprivileged user to potentially gain privileged access via local access.
Affected Products: Intel(R) VTune Amplifier 2018 for Windows* Update 3 and before.

Advisory: Intel® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel® IPP) Advisory
Description: Data leakage in cryptographic libraries for Intel(R) IPP before 2019 update1 release may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® IPP releases before 2019 update1.

Advisory: Intel® RAID Web Console 3 Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability Advisory
Description: Cross-site scripting in the Intel(R) RAID Web Console v3 for Windows* may allow an unauthenticated user to elevate privilege via remote access.
Affected Products: Intel® RAID Web Console v3 before 4.186.

Advisory: Intel® Ready Mode Technology File Permissions Advisory
Description: Improper file permissions in the installer for the Intel(R) Ready Mode Technology may allow an unprivileged user to potentially gain privileged access via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Ready Mode Technology – all versions.

Advisory: Intel® Media Server Studio for Windows* Vulnerability Advisory
Description: Improper directory permissions in the installer for the Intel(R) Media Server Studio may allow unprivileged users to potentially enable an escalation of privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Media Server Studio before 2019 Beta Release.

Advisory: Intel® RAID Web Console 3 for Windows* Authentication Bypass Advisory
Description: Authentication bypass in the Intel(R) RAID Web Console 3 for Windows* before 4.186 may allow an unprivileged user to potentially gain administrative privileges via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® RAID Web Console v3 for Windows* before version 4.186.

Affected Products: Intel® RAID Web Console for Windows* version 3 and before.

Affected Products: Intel® NUC Firmware Kits downloaded before May 24, 2018.

Advisory: Intel® Graphics Driver Unified Shader Compiler Advisory
Description: Denial of Service in Unified Shader Compiler in Intel(R) Graphics Drivers before10.18.x.5056 (aka 15.33.x.5056), 10.18.x.5057 (aka 15.36.x.5057) and 20.19.x.5058 (aka 15.40.x.5058) may allow an unprivileged user to potentially create an infinite loop and crash an application via local access.

Advisory: Intel® NVMe and Intel® RSTe Driver Pack Advisory
Description: Permissions in the driver pack installers for Intel(R) NVMe before version 4.0.0.1007 and Intel(R) RSTe before version 4.7.0.2083 may allow an authenticated user to potentially escalate privilege via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Client NVMe Versions 4.0.0.1006 and before. Datacenter NVMe Versions 4.0.0.1006 and before. Intel® RSTe before version 4.7.0.2083.

Description: Default install directory permissions in Intel® Distribution for Python (IDP) version 2018 may allow an unprivileged user to escalate privileges via local access.
Affected Products: Intel® Distribution for Python 2018 downloaded before Aug 6, 2018.

Description: Insufficient input validation in HECI subsystem in Intel(R) CSME before version 11.21.55, Intel® Server Platform Services before version 4.0 and Intel® Trusted Execution Engine Firmware before version 3.1.55 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privileges via local access.
Affected Products:
This vulnerability affects Intel® CSME firmware versions:  11.0 through 11.8.50; 11.10 through 11.11.50; 11.20 through 11.21.51, Intel® Server Platform Services firmware version 4.0 (on Purley and Bakerville only) and Intel® TXE version 3.0 through 3.1.50. Systems using Intel® CSME firmware versions prior to 11.0/ Intel® Server Platform Services 4.0/TXE 3.0 or using firmware versions 11.8.55/11.11.55/11.21.55/ Intel® Server Platform Services 5.0 and higher/TXE 3.1.55 or higher are not affected by this vulnerability. 3.1.50.2222  An unauthenticated user with physical access could potentially: •       Bypass Intel® CSME anti-replay protection, which may allow brute force attacks to expose information stored inside the Intel® CSME. •       Gain unauthorized access to the Intel® MEBX password. •       Tamper with the integrity of the Intel® CSME file system directories or the Server Platform Services and Trusted Execution Environment (Intel® TXE) data files. Mitigations described in INTEL-SA-00086 do not prevent the issue since a user with physical access to the system may be able to roll back to an earlier Intel® CSME firmware affected by CVE-2017-5705, CVE-2017-5706 and CVE-2017-5707.
